<!DOCTYPE html><html dir="ltr" lang="en"><head><meta charSet="utf-8"/><title>Labor Market Matching Efficiency and Koreas Low Post-Pandemic Unemployment</title><meta name="COMCampaigns" content=""/><meta name="Site" content="imf"/><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/><meta http-equiv="Cache-control" content="no-cache"/><meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"/><meta name="TemplateID" content="{13C90035-4700-4B86-B6CB-1B50F394423A}"/><meta name="creator" content="International Monetary Fund"/><meta name="robots" content="index, follow"/><meta name="Topic" content="Labor markets, Labor, Unemployment rate, Unemployment, Labor force, Labor force participation, Fund management"/><meta name="Type" content="Issue Page"/><meta name="Series" content="IMF Working Papers"/><meta name="Author" content="Hua Chai"/><meta name="PublicationSubject" content="Labor markets,Labor,Unemployment rate,Unemployment,Labor force,Labor force participation"/><meta name="Description" content="Following the COVID-19 pandemic, Korea’s unemployment rate has remained significantly lower than pre-pandemic levels. This paper examines the dynamics of unemployment through a framework of labor market flows incorporating a matching function and identifies a sustained increase in labor market matching efficiency as the primary driver of persistently low post-pandemic unemployment. The framework further suggests that, barring an unlikely reversal of these efficiency gains, the unemployment rate is likely to remain below 3 percent in the medium term. Notably, despite heightened labor market tightness, post-pandemic wage growth in Korea has been modest. The paper develops a variant of the Diamond-Mortensen-Pissarides model, demonstrating that increased labor market matching efficiency helps account for this apparent paradox."/><meta name="Keywords" content="unemployment,labor market matching efficiency,labor market tightness,wage growth,labor market flow,pandemic unemployment,Medium-term structural unemployment unemployment rate,growth in Korea,Labor markets,Unemployment rate,Labor force,Labor force participation"/><meta name="Date" content="2025-05-02"/><meta name="Language" content="ENG"/><meta property="og:site_name" content="IMF"/><meta property="og:type" content="article"/><meta property="og:url" content="https://www.imf.org/en/publications/wp/issues/2025/05/02/labor-market-matching-efficiency-and-koreas-low-post-pandemic-unemployment-566483"/><meta property="og:title" content="Labor Market Matching Efficiency and Koreas Low Post-Pandemic Unemployment"/><meta property="og:description" content="Following the COVID-19 pandemic, Korea’s unemployment rate has remained significantly lower than pre-pandemic levels. This paper examines the dynamics of unemployment through a framework of labor market flows incorporating a matching function and identifies a sustained increase in labor market matching efficiency as the primary driver of persistently low post-pandemic unemployment. The framework further suggests that, barring an unlikely reversal of these efficiency gains, the unemployment rate is likely to remain below 3 percent in the medium term. Notably, despite heightened labor market tightness, post-pandemic wage growth in Korea has been modest. The paper develops a variant of the Diamond-Mortensen-Pissarides model, demonstrating that increased labor market matching efficiency helps account for this apparent paradox."/><meta property="og:locale" content="en"/><meta property="og:image" content="https://www.imf.org/-/media/project/imf/shared/images/news/twitter-seal.png?h=405&amp;iar=0&amp;w=400"/><meta property="twitter:site" content="IMF"/><meta property="twitter:card" content="summary"/><meta property="twitter:title" content="Labor Market Matching Efficiency and Koreas Low Post-Pandemic Unemployment"/><meta property="twitter:description" content="Following the COVID-19 pandemic, Korea’s unemployment rate has remained significantly lower than pre-pandemic levels. This paper examines the dynamics of unemployment through a framework of labor market flows incorporating a matching function and identifies a sustained increase in labor market matching efficiency as the primary driver of persistently low post-pandemic unemployment. The framework further suggests that, barring an unlikely reversal of these efficiency gains, the unemployment rate is likely to remain below 3 percent in the medium term. Notably, despite heightened labor market tightness, post-pandemic wage growth in Korea has been modest. The paper develops a variant of the Diamond-Mortensen-Pissarides model, demonstrating that increased labor market matching efficiency helps account for this apparent paradox."/><meta property="twitter:image" content="https://www.imf.org/-/media/project/imf/shared/images/news/twitter-seal.png?h=405&amp;iar=0&amp;w=400"/><meta name="parsely-tags" content="Issue Page, Labor markets, Labor, Unemployment rate, Unemployment, Labor force, Labor force participation, Fund management, unemployment,labor market matching efficiency,labor market tightness,wage growth,labor market flow,pandemic unemployment,Medium-term structural unemployment unemployment rate,growth in Korea,Labor markets,Unemployment rate,Labor force,Labor force participation"/><meta name="parsely-title" content="Labor Market Matching Efficiency and Koreas Low Post-Pandemic Unemployment"/><meta name="parsely-section" content="publications"/><meta name="parsely-link" content="https://www.imf.org/en/publications/wp/issues/2025/05/02/labor-market-matching-efficiency-and-koreas-low-post-pandemic-unemployment-566483"/><meta name="parsely-type" content="post"/><meta name="parsely-image-url" content="https://www.imf.org/-/media/project/imf/shared/images/news/twitter-seal.png?h=405&amp;iar=0&amp;w=400"/><meta name="parsely-pub-date" content="2025-05-02"/><link src="https://www.imf.org/_next/static/chunks/pages/_app-c3343b8009236d4d.js?dpl=dpl_BM1KPn87S7BbnjoAJvfcjaR31Bt6" defer=""></script><script 9B97F49878A44E79BA67C090148083BB|B6DACDD7B0924564AE5E8F43B69FC218|024E5BB12A7E4D33A80912B916B6215F ; 9B97F49878A44E79BA67C090148083BB|B6DACDD7B0924564AE5E8F43B69FC218 ; 9B97F49878A44E79BA67C090148083BB ; 9B97F49878A44E79BA67C090148083BB|B6DACDD7B0924564AE5E8F43B69FC218|CD1107B41C9B47AC85FA9DC9BBF2AFA2 ; 9B97F49878A44E79BA67C090148083BB|B6DACDD7B0924564AE5E8F43B69FC218 ; 9B97F49878A44E79BA67C090148083BB ; 9B97F49878A44E79BA67C090148083BB|B6DACDD7B0924564AE5E8F43B69FC218|CD1107B41C9B47AC85FA9DC9BBF2AFA2|BFAA85A2B3AF45C2901BF5D866F3DC54 ; 9B97F49878A44E79BA67C090148083BB|B6DACDD7B0924564AE5E8F43B69FC218|CD1107B41C9B47AC85FA9DC9BBF2AFA2 ; 9B97F49878A44E79BA67C090148083BB|B6DACDD7B0924564AE5E8F43B69FC218 ; 9B97F49878A44E79BA67C090148083BB ; 0EB095FD943540C78F9247954860BD56|2F5E6E77E2C44E11872EB7D14FFE7FEF ; 0EB095FD943540C78F9247954860BD56"/><input type="hidden" name="imftype" id="imftype" value="Issue Page"/><input type="hidden" name="imftopic" id="imftopic" value=""/><input type="hidden" name="imfsubject" id="imfsubject" value=""/><input type="hidden" name="templateName" id="templateName" value="Issue Page"/><input type="hidden" name="imfspeaker" id="imfspeaker" value=""/><input type="hidden" name="imfdescription" id="imfdescription" value="Following the COVID-19 pandemic, Korea’s unemployment rate has remained significantly lower than pre-pandemic levels. This paper examines the dynamics of unemployment through a framework of labor market flows incorporating a matching function and identifies a sustained increase in labor market matching efficiency as the primary driver of persistently low post-pandemic unemployment. The framework further suggests that, barring an unlikely reversal of these efficiency gains, the unemployment rate is likely to remain below 3 percent in the medium term. Notably, despite heightened labor market tightness, post-pandemic wage growth in Korea has been modest. The paper develops a variant of the Diamond-Mortensen-Pissarides model, demonstrating that increased labor market matching efficiency helps account for this apparent paradox."/><input type="hidden" name="imfcol" id="imfcol" value="IMFORG-MAIN"/><input type="hidden" name="imfauthor" id="imfauthor" value="Hua Chai"/><input type="hidden" name="imfkeywords" id="imfkeywords" value="unemployment,labor rate,Labor force,Labor force participation"/><input type="hidden" name="alltemplates" id="alltemplates" value="13C9003547004B86B6CB1B50F394423A;3830E1794E0945C59B5EF357F45E04AE;0160C34A1D7343B4AC1907A258BCCF10;BB07B824E2244A60A38F78AB845C442A;7E0E85BFFC9E4C2A8BB4C14763C673BF;F01EC5E4BA6948D6B8C8C116C06D1E32;D63CB72591E9405B93E64E71B98646FB;E5B5AC03824E4210B9C3C388BED98821;C9EBBC6349164466AD1513867961A680;B24AAA0DCE26485D806F19F052F92F8D;C1C8F714193041BCB06740304892DE81;CCE191F2036C40BE875F3AA6856A0E9C;3DBAD8722A9F4072823863A941BCDF50;FE3149492CF94CCABD95925CB38F1319;2C5C3B660B4644C0875E68D8D3080C6F;89F46FB1C9AC4937B483B95D6233D4E3;D2BE810BAEF148CFA2857645283D6D99;47F5BA91CE734E78889CB3DA2C7A2631;2115A4752A334C8389C0B9970CA81909;15D2BC5A0622417E996F80914280CB0E;B726EE569EDB4F5489CEFFD8F746294F;04404C79FE2B4792A801B4C7D7497F28;0DAE96BD1EBD47D9B7A75426CA6EEAC1;1E55D827D18446F9803E90EDDD810FFA;8B8BDEE0C2DB4E5F8CD45D813AAF48DA;11F5968890584703B4D85EF843E27AAA;5CF2A71FFEF244358A495DC90D241A41;169E6942F3A54EB688008D984AB67BAA;8006200114C84313B2E8A86B5D3E52A5;381F165A337741CC8C49BAD103DE3768;FC40B13C9EC947509275A8B8C53B3F16;4715171126CA434E8132D3E0B7D26683;3F8A6A5D7B1A45668CD40A50F3030BD8;4414A1F9826A46478DF4ED6A95E64C43;6650FB347EA14245A9195CC0F002A6D7;1C2434308C0D4AE3862509CE8F3197B7;6D5F3C0440C94AABBAA398B0F9E9773D;04942AC7C0CF43DA8EAC59E25DA61B27;5ED7742617E54532847689C21A6F7F54"/><input         <li><a href="/en/topics/artificial-intelligence">Artificial Intelligence</a></li>
        <li><a href="/en/topics/digital-payments-and-finance">Fintech</a></li>
        <li><a href="/en/topics/fiscal-policies">Fiscal Policies</a></li>
        <li><a href="/en/topics/governance-and-anti-corruption">Governance and Anti-Corruption</a></li>
        <li><a href="/en/topics">All Topics</a></li>
    </ul>
    </div>
    <!-- -->
    </li>
</ul></li><li class="droopmenu-parent droopmenu-mega"><a href="https://www.imf.org/en/research">Research<em class="droopmenu-topanim"></em></a><button aria-controls="submenu-FD59FCBAD03946BF8A54ADF39B8C184F" aria-expanded="false" aria-label="submenu Research" class="droopmenu-indicator"><em></em></button><div class="dm-arrow"></div><ul class="droopmenu-megamenu droopmenu-grid" id="submenu-FD59FCBAD03946BF8A54ADF39B8C184F" role="region" aria-label="submenu Research">

id="a64b9f16-eca8-46ad-b032-c883b2241a6a" class="full-width bg-blue padded-vertical-10  "><div class="contain"><h1 class="titlebar">IMF Working Papers</h1></div></div><!--/$--><div class="hero"></div><!--$--><main class="publication-container flex-container text-left " id="c7a7a935-224a-426e-85a6-af9bc24f18b1"><aside class="publication-container__aside publication-flex-column"><!--$--><section class="publication-cover desktop-only" id="d72b5279-ca6d-41b9-a5fa-5d0f4057ab45"><a aria-label="Series Page" href="https://www.imf.org/en/publications/wp"><img alt="" width="569" height="746" class="publication-cover__img" src="https://www.imf.org/-/media/images/imf/publications/cover-images/working-papers.png?h=746&amp;iar=0&amp;w=569"/></a></section><!--/$--><!--$--><!--/$--><!--$--><section class="publication-promo desktop-only  " id="312425ec-075c-445b-8965-2724b7069e7a" aria-label="Publication Promo" data-testid="publication-promo"><div class="publication-promo__wrapper"><h3 class="publication-promo__title publication-title-text" aria-level="3">Visit the IMF eLibrary</h3><p class="publication-promo__content publication-text">Our eLibrary offers over 25,000 IMF publications in multiple formats.</p><a href="https://www.elibrary.imf.org/" class="publication-promo__btn btn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Explore</a></div></section><!--/$--><!--$--><section class="publication-promo desktop-only  " id="2e65321f-8698-4c50-befc-504a1606aedc" aria-label="Publication Promo" data-testid="publication-promo"><div class="publication-promo__wrapper"><h3 class="publication-promo__title publication-title-text" aria-level="3">IMF Publications Newsletter</h3><p class="publication-promo__content publication-text">Latest economic research and insights delivered to your inbox each month.</p><a href="https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/Newsletter/registration" class="publication-promo__btn btn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Subscribe</a></div></section><!--/$--></aside><article class="publication-container__main publication-flex-column"><!--$--><div id="800801d5-6660-4335-8dde-56cd81d2884a" class="publication-details-wrapper"><div class="publication-top-area"><section class="publication-top-area__wrapper"><h2 class="publication-title">Labor Market Matching Efficiency and Koreas Low Post-Pandemic Unemployment</h2><p class="publication-short-info__author">By<a href="https://www.imf.org/en/publications/publications-by-author?author=Hua%20Chai&amp;name=Hua Chai">Hua Chai</a></p><p class="publication-short-info__date">May 2, 2025</p><section class="publication-actions" role="list"><div role="listitem"><a class="publication-actions__btn btn publication-actions__btn-primary" data-nimg="1" style="color:transparent" src="https://www.imf.org/_next/static/media/download.36652d94.svg"/>Download PDF</a></div><div role="listitem" class="publication-actions__listitem href="https://elibrary.imf.org/view/journals/001/2025/082/001.2025.issue-082-en.xml?cid=lk-com-dsp-imf.org"><img alt="book open icon" aria-hidden="true" loading="lazy" width="18" height="18" decoding="async" data-nimg="1" style="color:transparent" src="https://www.imf.org/_next/static/media/book-open.bcb153f5.svg"/>More Formats on IMF eLibrary</a></div><div role="listitem" class="publication-actions__listitem desktop-only"><a class="publication-actions__btn btn publication-actions__btn-tertiary desktop-only" href="https://www.bookstore.imf.org/cart?isbn=9798229008921"><img alt="book icon" aria-hidden="true" loading="lazy" width="18" height="18" decoding="async" data-nimg="1" style="color:transparent" id="social-widget" class="publication-share-popup popup" style="display:none"><div class="sharethis-inline-share-buttons" role="list"></div><button class="cancel-btn" desktop-hide" role="list"><div role="listitem"><button class="publication-actions__btn-more" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="publicationMoreActionsList"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" tabindex="-1"><div role="listitem"><button class="publication-actions__btn publication-text" style="width:100%">Create Citation</button></div><div role="listitem"><a class="publication-actions__btn" target="_blank" href="https://elibrary.imf.org/view/journals/001/2025/082/001.2025.issue-082-en.xml?cid=lk-com-dsp-imf.org">More formats on IMF eLibrary</a></div><div role="listitem"><a class="publication-actions__btn" target="_blank" href="https://www.bookstore.imf.org/cart?isbn=9798229008921">Order a Print Copy</a></div></div></div></section></section></div><dialog class="dialog-modal" aria-labelledby="publicationCitationTitle"><style>
        .dialog-modal::backdrop {
          background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25) !important;
        }
      </style><div class="publication-citation__wrapper"><div class="publication-citation__preview"><div class="publication-citation__title-line"><h2 id="publicationCitationTitle" class="publication-citation__title">Preview Citation</h2><div class="publication-citation__actions"><div class="publication-citation__format-wrapper"><button class="publication-actions__btn btn publication-actions__btn-secondary"><img alt="copy icon" aria-hidden="true" loading="lazy" width="16" height="16" decoding="async" data-nimg="1" style="color:transparent" src="https://www.imf.org/_next/static/media/copy.1ab8f531.svg"/>Copy</button><p>Format: Chicago</p></div><button class="publication-actions__btn-close" aria-label="Close"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="18" height="18" viewBox="0 0 18 18" fill="none" aria-hidden="true"><path d="M4.2 15L3 13.8L7.8 9L3 4.2L4.2 3L9 7.8L13.8 3L15 4.2L10.2 9L15 13.8L13.8 15L9 10.2L4.2 15Z" fill="#707372"></path></svg></button></div></div><div class="publication-citation__text publication-text">Hua Chai. "Labor Market Matching Efficiency and Koreas Low Post-Pandemic Unemployment", <em>IMF Working Papers</em> 2025, 082 (2025), accessed 2/4/2026, <a href="https://doi.org/10.5089/9798229008921.001" target="_blank">https://doi.org/10.5089/9798229008921.001</a></div></div><div class="publication-citation__export"><h3>Export Citation</h3><div class="publication-citation__export-options"><div class="publication-citation__export-option"><button class="publication-actions__btn btn publication-actions__btn-tertiary citation-btn" data-type="ris" data-doi="https://doi.org/10.5089/9798229008921.001"><img alt="download icon" loading="lazy" width="18" height="18" decoding="async" data-nimg="1" style="color:transparent" src="https://www.imf.org/_next/static/media/download.36652d94.svg"/>.ris</button><ul class="publication-citation__export-list"><li>ProCite</li><li>RefWorks</li><li>Reference Manager</li></ul></div><div class="publication-citation__export-option"><button class="publication-actions__btn btn publication-actions__btn-tertiary citation-btn" data-type="bibtex" data-doi="https://doi.org/10.5089/9798229008921.001"><img alt="download icon" loading="lazy" width="18" height="18" decoding="async" data-nimg="1" style="color:transparent" src="https://www.imf.org/_next/static/media/download.36652d94.svg"/>.bib</button><ul><li>BibTex</li><li>Zotero</li></ul></div><div class="publication-citation__export-option"><button class="publication-actions__btn btn publication-actions__btn-tertiary citation-btn" data-type="enw" data-doi="https://doi.org/10.5089/9798229008921.001"><img alt="download icon" loading="lazy" width="18" height="18" decoding="async" data-nimg="1" style="color:transparent" src="https://www.imf.org/_next/static/media/download.36652d94.svg"/>.enw</button><ul><li>EndNote</li></ul></div></div></div></div></dialog><section><div class="publication-disclaimer publication-text"><div><p><strong>Disclaimer:</strong> IMF Working Papers describe research in progress by the author(s) and are published to elicit comments and to encourage debate. The views expressed in IMF Working Papers are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily represent the views of the IMF, its Executive Board, or IMF management.</p></div></div></section><section class="publication-summary publication-text"><h3 class="publication-summary__title">Summary</h3><div class="publication-text">Following the COVID-19 pandemic, Korea’s unemployment rate has remained significantly lower than pre-pandemic levels. This paper examines the dynamics of unemployment through a framework of labor market flows incorporating a matching function and identifies a sustained increase in labor market matching efficiency as the primary driver of persistently low post-pandemic unemployment. The framework further suggests that, barring an unlikely reversal of these efficiency gains, the unemployment rate is likely to remain below 3 percent in the medium term. Notably, despite heightened labor market tightness, post-pandemic wage growth in Korea has been modest. The paper develops a variant of the Diamond-Mortensen-Pissarides model, demonstrating that increased labor market matching efficiency helps account for this apparent paradox.</div></section><section class="publication-additional-info"><p class="publication-additional-info__line"><strong>Subject<!-- -->: </strong><span role="list" style="flex:1"><span role="listitem"><a href="https://www.imf.org/en/publications/publications-by-subject?subject=Labor">Labor</a>, </span><span role="listitem"><a href="https://www.imf.org/en/publications/publications-by-subject?subject=Labor force">Labor force</a>, </span><span role="listitem"><a href="https://www.imf.org/en/publications/publications-by-subject?subject=Labor force participation">Labor force participation</a>, </span><span role="listitem"><a href="https://www.imf.org/en/publications/publications-by-subject?subject=Labor markets">Labor markets</a>, </span><span role="listitem"><a href="https://www.imf.org/en/publications/publications-by-subject?subject=Unemployment">Unemployment</a>, </span><span role="listitem"><a href="https://www.imf.org/en/publications/publications-by-subject?subject=Unemployment rate">Unemployment rate</a></span></span></p><p class="publication-additional-info__line"><strong>Keywords<!-- -->: </strong><span role="list" style="flex:1"><span role="listitem">growth in Korea, </span><span role="listitem">Labor force, </span><span role="listitem">Labor force participation, </span><span role="listitem">labor market flow, </span><span role="listitem">labor market matching efficiency, </span><span role="listitem">labor market tightness, </span><span role="listitem">Labor markets, </span><span role="listitem">Medium-term structural unemployment unemployment rate, </span><span role="listitem">pandemic unemployment, </span><span role="listitem">unemployment, </span><span role="listitem">Unemployment rate, </span><span role="listitem">wage growth</span></span></p></section><section class="publication-details open"><h3 class="publication-details__title"><button aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="publicationDetailsList">Publication Details<i class="publication-details__expand-icon" aria-hidden="true"></i></button></h3><ul class="publication-details__list" id="publicationDetailsList"><li class="publication-details__category"><p role="presentation">Pages<!-- -->:</p><p role="presentation">23</p></li><li class="publication-details__category"><p role="presentation">Volume<!-- -->:</p><p role="presentation">2025</p></li><li class="publication-details__category"><p role="presentation">DOI<!-- -->:</p><p role="presentation"><a href="https://doi.org/10.5089/9798229008921.001">https://doi.org/10.5089/9798229008921.001</a></p></li><li class="publication-details__category"><p role="presentation">Issue<!-- -->:</p><p role="presentation">082</p></li><li class="publication-details__category"><p role="presentation">Series<!-- -->:</p><p role="presentation">Working Paper No. 2025/082</p></li><li class="publication-details__category"><p role="presentation">Stock No<!-- -->:</p><p role="presentation">WPIEA2025082</p></li><li class="publication-details__category"><p role="presentation">ISBN<!-- role="presentation">1018-5941</p></li></ul></section></div><!--/$--><!--$--><!--/$--><!--$--><section class="publication-related-content  " id="e6decca6-61b6-4b56-9c6b-1eab1dae8b87"><h3 Working Papers"},"SeriesVolumeNo":{"value":"Working Paper No. 2025/082"},"SortTitle":{"value":""},"SubjectDescription":[{"id":"3ee25a93-c0e9-416a-acc0-996577c7e4c6","url":"/en/settings/globals/publications/subjects/2016/12/30/labor-markets","name":"Labor markets","displayName":"Labor markets","fields":{"Title":{"value":"Labor markets"},"FirstLetter":{"value":"L"}}},{"id":"b42e4858-c493-4e3d-9ad0-791d96c6d48f","url":"/en/settings/globals/publications/subjects/2016/12/30/labor","name":"Labor","displayName":"Labor","fields":{"Title":{"value":"Labor"},"FirstLetter":{"value":"L"}}},{"id":"271ee53d-ca09-4b07-9dd9-dd5730f031ca","url":"/en/settings/globals/publications/subjects/2020/10/27/unemployment-rate","name":"Unemployment rate","displayName":"Unemployment rate","fields":{"Title":{"value":"Unemployment rate"},"FirstLetter":{"value":"U"}}},{"id":"62202b1f-5efd-4538-aa8d-f838bceac5c9","url":"/en/settings/globals/publications/subjects/2016/12/30/unemployment","name":"Unemployment","displayName":"Unemployment","fields":{"Title":{"value":"Unemployment"},"FirstLetter":{"value":"U"}}},{"id":"b79b9821-cbf3-4a01-b36d-17c655941333","url":"/en/settings/globals/publications/subjects/2016/12/31/labor-force","name":"Labor force","displayName":"Labor force","fields":{"Title":{"value":"Labor force"},"FirstLetter":{"value":"L"}}},{"id":"eaee074a-cdf3-4ed3-a0e7-dda743e2300f","url":"/en/settings/globals/publications/subjects/2016/12/31/labor-force-participation","name":"Labor force participation","displayName":"Labor force participation","fields":{"Title":{"value":"Labor force participation"},"FirstLetter":{"value":"L"}}}],"VolumeNumber":{"value":"2025"},"WebNotes":{"value":""},"CoverImage":{"value":{}},"ShortTitle":{"value":""},"AdditionalMedia":{"value":""},"DataSets":[],"Disclaimer":{"value":"[$token_name=\"PublicationDisclaimer\"]","contentTokens":[{"name":"PublicationDisclaimer","value":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDisclaimer:\u003c/strong\u003e IMF Working Papers describe research in progress by the author(s) and are published to elicit comments and to encourage debate. The views expressed in IMF Working Papers are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily represent the views of the IMF, its Executive Board, or IMF management.\u003c/p\u003e"}]},"ISBN":{"value":"9798229008921"},"ISSN":{"value":"1018-5941"},"Notes":{"value":""},"IssueDownloadList":{"value":"{\"LinkListItems\":[]}"},"IssueDownload7Text":{"value":""},"IssueDownload8":{"value":{"href":""}},"IssueDownload8Text":{"value":""},"IssueDownload9":{"value":{"href":""}},"IssueDownload9Text":{"value":""},"IssueDownload1":{"value":{"href":""}},"IssueDownload10":{"value":{"href":""}},"IssueDownload10Text":{"value":""},"IssueDownload11":{"value":{"href":""}},"IssueDownload11Text":{"value":""},"IssueDownload12":{"value":{"href":""}},"IssueDownload12Text":{"value":""},"IssueDownload1Text":{"value":""},"IssueDownload2":{"value":{"href":""}},"IssueDownload2Text":{"value":""},"IssueDownload3":{"value":{"href":""}},"IssueDownload3Text":{"value":""},"IssueDownload4":{"value":{"href":""}},"IssueDownload4Text":{"value":""},"IssueDownload5":{"value":{"href":""}},"IssueDownload5Text":{"value":""},"IssueDownload6":{"value":{"href":""}},"IssueDownload6Text":{"value":""},"IssueDownload7":{"value":{"href":""}},"Abstract":{"value":"Following the COVID-19 pandemic, Korea’s unemployment rate has remained significantly lower than pre-pandemic levels. This paper examines the dynamics of unemployment through a framework of labor market flows incorporating a matching function and identifies a sustained increase in labor market matching efficiency as the primary driver of persistently low post-pandemic unemployment. The framework further suggests that, barring an unlikely reversal of these efficiency gains, the unemployment rate is likely to remain below 3 percent in the medium term. Notably, despite heightened labor market tightness, post-pandemic wage growth in Korea has been modest. The paper develops a variant of the Diamond-Mortensen-Pissarides model, demonstrating that increased labor market matching efficiency helps account for this apparent paradox."},"SerialNumber":{"value":""},"ContentTitle":{"value":""},"Subtitle":{"value":""},"LegacySidebarContent":{"value":""},"Image":{"value":{}},"Content":{"value":""},"Title":{"value":"Labor Market Matching Efficiency and Koreas Low Post-Pandemic Unemployment"},"WhatsNewShortTitle":{"value":""},"BlockedCountries":[],"ForcedCountries":[],"QuestionableCountries":[],"ScannedCountries":[],"BlockedRegions":[],"ForcedRegions":[],"QuestionableRegions":[],"ScannedRegions":[],"BlockedCampaigns":[],"ForcedCampaigns":[],"ScannedCampaigns":[],"BlockedCountryNews":[],"ForcedCountryNews":[],"ScannedCountryNews":[],"BlockedEBVEFTopics":[],"ForcedEBVEFTopics":[],"ScannedEBVEFTopics":[{"id":"b6dacdd7-b092-4564-ae5e-8f43b69fc218","url":"https://localhost/en/sitecore/content/imf/shared/settings/globals/taxonomy/ebv-e-and-f-topics/real-sector/labor-markets","name":"Labor Main-58614328":[{"uid":"800801d5-6660-4335-8dde-56cd81d2884a","componentName":"IssueDetails","dataSource":"","params":{"FieldNames":"Default"},"fields":{"data":{"publicationsBySubjectPage":{"url":{"url":"https://www.imf.org/en/publications/publications-by-subject"}},"publicationsByAuthorPage":{"url":{"url":"https://www.imf.org/en/publications/publications-by-author"}},"issue":{"languages":[{"url":{"url":"https://www.imf.org/en/publications/wp/issues/2025/05/02/labor-market-matching-efficiency-and-koreas-low-post-pandemic-unemployment-566483"},"language":{"name":"en","nativeName":"English"}}],"disclaimer":{"value":"[$token_name=\"PublicationDisclaimer\"]","jsonValue":{"value":"[$token_name=\"PublicationDisclaimer\"]","contentTokens":[{"name":"PublicationDisclaimer","value":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDisclaimer:\u003c/strong\u003e IMF Working Papers describe research in progress by the author(s) and are published to elicit comments and to encourage debate. The views expressed in IMF Working Papers are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily represent the views of the IMF, its Executive Board, or IMF management.\u003c/p\u003e"}]}},"authorNames":{"targetItems":[{"authorName":{"value":"Hua Chai"}}]},"abstract":{"value":"Following the COVID-19 pandemic, Korea’s unemployment rate has remained significantly lower than pre-pandemic levels. This paper examines the dynamics of unemployment through a framework of labor market flows incorporating a matching function and identifies a sustained increase in labor market matching efficiency as the primary driver of persistently low post-pandemic unemployment. The framework further suggests that, barring an unlikely reversal of these efficiency gains, the unemployment rate is likely to remain below 3 percent in the medium term. Notably, despite heightened labor market tightness, post-pandemic wage growth in Korea has been modest. The paper develops a variant of the Diamond-Mortensen-Pissarides model, demonstrating that increased labor market matching efficiency helps account for this apparent paradox."},"editorsList":{"value":""},"corpAuths":{"value":""},"yearPublished":{"value":"2025"},"excludeFromBookStore":{"value":"0"},"bookstoreURL":{"url":"https://www.bookstore.imf.org/cart?isbn=9798229008921"},"issueNumber":{"value":"082"},"metaKeywords":{"value":"unemployment,labor market matching efficiency,labor market tightness,wage growth,labor market flow,pandemic unemployment,Medium-term structural unemployment unemployment rate,growth in Korea,Labor markets,Unemployment rate,Labor force,Labor force participation"},"dTDType":{"value":"Journal"},"catNo":{"value":"9798229008921/1018-5941"},"iSBN":{"value":"9798229008921"},"iSSN":{"value":"1018-5941"},"linkToText":{"url":"https://www.imf.org/-/media/files/publications/wp/2025/english/wpiea2025082-print-pdf.pdf"},"dOI":{"value":"10.5089/9798229008921.001"},"actualELibraryURL":{"value":"https://elibrary.imf.org/view/journals/001/2025/082/001.2025.issue-082-en.xml?cid=lk-com-dsp-imf.org"},"publicationDate":{"value":"20250502T040000Z"},"seriesDescription":{"value":"IMF IMF Working Papers describe research in progress by the author(s) and are published to elicit comments and to encourage debate. The views expressed in IMF Working Papers are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily represent the views of the IMF, its Executive Board, or IMF management.\u003c/p\u003e"}]}},"authorNames":{"targetItems":[{"authorName":{"value":"Hua Chai"}}]},"abstract":{"value":"Following the COVID-19 pandemic, Korea’s unemployment rate has remained significantly lower than pre-pandemic levels. This paper examines the dynamics of unemployment through a framework of labor market flows incorporating a matching function and identifies a sustained increase in labor market matching efficiency as the primary driver of persistently low post-pandemic unemployment. The framework further suggests that, barring an unlikely reversal of these efficiency gains, the unemployment rate is likely to remain below 3 percent in the medium term. Notably, despite heightened labor market tightness, post-pandemic wage growth in Korea has been modest. The paper develops a variant of the Diamond-Mortensen-Pissarides model, demonstrating that increased labor market matching efficiency helps account for this apparent paradox."},"editorsList":{"value":""},"corpAuths":{"value":""},"yearPublished":{"value":"2025"},"excludeFromBookStore":{"value":"0"},"bookstoreURL":{"url":"https://www.bookstore.imf.org/cart?isbn=9798229008921"},"issueNumber":{"value":"082"},"metaKeywords":{"value":"unemployment,labor market matching efficiency,labor market tightness,wage growth,labor market flow,pandemic unemployment,Medium-term structural unemployment unemployment rate,growth in Korea,Labor markets,Unemployment rate,Labor force,Labor force participation"},"dTDType":{"value":"Journal"},"catNo":{"value":"9798229008921/1018-5941"},"iSBN":{"value":"9798229008921"},"iSSN":{"value":"1018-5941"},"linkToText":{"url":"https://www.imf.org/-/media/files/publications/wp/2025/english/wpiea2025082-print-pdf.pdf"},"dOI":{"value":"10.5089/9798229008921.001"},"actualELibraryURL":{"value":"https://elibrary.imf.org/view/journals/001/2025/082/001.2025.issue-082-en.xml?cid=lk-com-dsp-imf.org"},"publicationDate":{"value":"20250502T040000Z"},"seriesDescription":{"value":"IMF
